ing: 1 (.7 ounce) package dry Italian salad dressing mix (such as Good SeasonsÂ®)
des: "My aunt used to make this delicious side dish when I would visit, and I recently discovered just how easy it is to make. A great way to encourage kids to eat their broccoli! Blanching of broccoli or any form of cooking broccoli is not recommended for this recipe; it tastes best with raw, chilled broccoli."
ins:
Combine olive oil, red wine vinegar, and Italian dressing mix in a sealable container; shake vigorously.
Place broccoli in a plastic storage container, cover with marinade, and refrigerate, stirring occasionally, for at least 3 hours.
